content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: --ENRTPT
      operator: exists
    - name: -ENTPT
      operator: not_exists
CoreId: VariablePresenceExample
Description: Raise an error when --ENRTPT exists in a dataset, --ENTPT does not exist.
Outcome:
  Message: --ENRTPT exists in a dataset, but --ENTPT does not exist.
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Dataset
Version: '1'
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.3'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0058
            Version: '1.1'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: (--ENTPT) Description or date/time in ISO 8601 or
                  other character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred
                  to by --ENRTPT.
                Document: SDTM v1.4
                Section: 2.2.5 Timing Variables for All Classes
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - ALL
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL
Core:
  Status: Draft

json.Description: Raise an error when --ENRTPT exists in a dataset, --ENTPT does not exist.

Outcome.Message: --ENRTPT exists in a dataset, but --ENTPT does not exist.

Citations.Cited_Guidance: (--ENTPT) Description or date/time in ISO 8601 or other character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by --ENRTPT.
